message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.LG 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category as it deals with processing speech audio data for information extraction, topic detection, or browsing/playback by segmenting the input into sentence and topic units. It also uses statistical language models and hidden Markov modeling techniques to achieve this. 

The paper may also belong to the Sound (cs.SD) sub-category as it deals with analyzing the timing and melody of speech to extract prosodic cues. 

The paper may also belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as it deals with processing speech data from two speech corpora, Broadcast News and Switchboard, which are social networks of sorts. 

The paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it uses decision tree and hidden Markov modeling techniques to combine prosodic cues with word-based approaches.
